description.compact: Process is a thin wrapper around proc_* functions to easily start independent PHP processes.
Exit codes translation table.

docblock.description: User-defined errors must use exit codes in the 64-113 range.

param.description: The working directory or null to use the working dir of the current PHP process
The environment variables or null to use the same environment as the current PHP process
The timeout in seconds or null to disable
An array of options for proc_open

throws.description: When proc_open is not installed

comment.value: on Windows, if the cwd changed via chdir(), proc_open defaults to the dir where PHP was started
on Gnu/Linux, PHP builds with --enable-maintainer-zts are also affected

description.compact: Runs the process.

docblock.description:
The callback receives the type of output (out or err) and some bytes from the output in real-time. It allows to have feedback from the independent process during execution.
The STDOUT and STDERR are also available after the process is finished via the getOutput() and getErrorOutput() methods.

param.description: A PHP callback to run whenever there is some

docblock.param: output available on STDOUT or STDERR

throws.description: When process can't be launched
When process stopped after receiving signal
In case a callback is provided and output has been disabled

description.compact: Runs the process.

docblock.description: This is identical to run() except that an exception is thrown if the process exits with a non-zero exit code.

throws.description: if PHP was compiled with --enable-sigchild and the enhanced sigchild compatibility mode is not enabled
if the process didn't terminate successfully

description.compact: Starts the process and returns after writing the input to STDIN.

docblock.description:
This method blocks until all STDIN data is sent to the process then it returns while the process runs in the background.
The termination of the process can be awaited with wait().
The callback receives the type of output (out or err) and some bytes from the output in real-time while writing the standard input to the process. It allows to have feedback from the independent process during execution.

param.description: A PHP callback to run whenever there is some

docblock.param: output available on STDOUT or STDERR

throws.description: When process can't be launched
When process is already running
In case a callback is provided and output has been disabled

description.compact: Restarts the process.

docblock.description: Be warned that the process is cloned before being started.

param.description: A PHP callback to run whenever there is some

docblock.param: output available on STDOUT or STDERR

throws.description: When process can't be launched
When process is already running

description.compact: Waits for the process to terminate.

docblock.description: The callback receives the type of output (out or err) and some bytes from the output in real-time while writing the standard input to the process. It allows to have feedback from the independent process during execution.

throws.description: When process timed out
When process stopped after receiving signal
When process is not yet started

description.compact: Returns the Pid (process identifier), if applicable.

return.description: The process id if running, null otherwise

description.compact: Sends a POSIX signal to the process.

throws.description: In case the process is not running
In case --enable-sigchild is activated and the process can't be killed
In case of failure

description.compact: Disables fetching output and error output from the underlying process.

throws.description: In case the process is already running
if an idle timeout is set

description.compact: Enables fetching output and error output from the underlying process.

throws.description: In case the process is already running

description.compact: Returns true in case the output is disabled, false otherwise.
Returns the current output of the process (STDOUT).

throws.description: in case the output has been disabled
In case the process is not started

description.compact: Returns the output incrementally.

docblock.description: In comparison with the getOutput method which always return the whole output, this one returns the new output since the last call.

return.description: The process output since the last call

throws.description: in case the output has been disabled
In case the process is not started

description.compact: Clears the process output.
Returns the current error output of the process (STDERR).

throws.description: in case the output has been disabled
In case the process is not started

description.compact: Returns the errorOutput incrementally.

docblock.description: In comparison with the getErrorOutput method which always return the whole error output, this one returns the new error output since the last call.

return.description: The process error output since the last call

throws.description: in case the output has been disabled
In case the process is not started

description.compact: Clears the process output.
Returns the exit code returned by the process.

return.description: The exit status code, null if the Process is not terminated

throws.description: In case --enable-sigchild is activated and the sigchild compatibility mode is disabled

description.compact: Returns a string representation for the exit code returned by the process.

docblock.description: This method relies on the Unix exit code status standardization and might not be relevant for other operating systems.

return.description: A string representation for the exit status code, null if the Process is not terminated

description.compact: Checks if the process ended successfully.

return.description: true if the process ended successfully, false otherwise

description.compact: Returns true if the child process has been terminated by an uncaught signal.

docblock.description: It always returns false on Windows.

throws.description: In case --enable-sigchild is activated
In case the process is not terminated

description.compact: Returns the number of the signal that caused the child process to terminate its execution.

docblock.description: It is only meaningful if hasBeenSignaled() returns true.

throws.description: In case --enable-sigchild is activated
In case the process is not terminated

description.compact: Returns true if the child process has been stopped by a signal.

docblock.description: It always returns false on Windows.

throws.description: In case the process is not terminated

description.compact: Returns the number of the signal that caused the child process to stop its execution.

docblock.description: It is only meaningful if hasBeenStopped() returns true.

throws.description: In case the process is not terminated

description.compact: Checks if the process is currently running.

return.description: true if the process is currently running, false otherwise

description.compact: Checks if the process has been started with no regard to the current state.

return.description: true if status is ready, false otherwise

description.compact: Checks if the process is terminated.

return.description: true if process is terminated, false otherwise

description.compact: Gets the process status.

docblock.description: The status is one of: ready, started, terminated.

description.compact: Stops the process.

param.description: A POSIX signal to send in case the process has not stop at timeout, default is SIGKILL (9)

description.compact: Adds a line to the STDOUT stream.
Adds a line to the STDERR stream.
Gets the command line to be executed.
Sets the command line to be executed.
Gets the process timeout (max. runtime).

return.description: The timeout in seconds or null if it's disabled

description.compact: Gets the process idle timeout (max. time since last output).

return.description: The timeout in seconds or null if it's disabled

description.compact: Sets the process timeout (max. runtime).

docblock.description: To disable the timeout, set this value to null.

throws.description: if the timeout is negative

description.compact: Sets the process idle timeout (max. time since last output).

docblock.description: To disable the timeout, set this value to null.

throws.description: if the output is disabled
if the timeout is negative

description.compact: Enables or disables the TTY mode.

param.description: True to enabled and false to disable

throws.description: In case the TTY mode is not supported

description.compact: Checks if the TTY mode is enabled.

return.description: true if the TTY mode is enabled, false otherwise

description.compact: Sets PTY mode.
Returns PTY state.
Gets the working directory.

return.description: The current working directory or null on failure

description.compact: Sets the current working directory.
Gets the environment variables.
Sets the environment variables.

docblock.description:
An environment variable value should be a string. If it is an array, the variable is ignored.
That happens in PHP when 'argv' is registered into the $_ENV array for instance.

comment.value: Process can not handle env values that are arrays

description.compact: Gets the contents of STDIN.

deprecated.value: since version 2.5, to be removed in 3.0.

docblock.deprecated: Use setInput() instead. This method is deprecated in favor of getInput.

description.compact: Gets the Process input.
Sets the contents of STDIN.

deprecated.value: since version 2.5, to be removed in 3.0.

throws.description: In case the process is running
In case the argument is invalid

description.compact: Sets the input.

docblock.description: This content will be passed to the underlying process standard input.

throws.description: In case the process is running

docblock.throws: Passing an object as an input is deprecated since version 2.5 and will be removed in 3.0.

description.compact: Gets the options for proc_open.
Sets the options for proc_open.
Gets whether or not Windows compatibility is enabled.

docblock.description: This is true by default.

description.compact: Sets whether or not Windows compatibility is enabled.
Returns whether sigchild compatibility mode is activated or not.
Activates sigchild compatibility mode.

docblock.description: Sigchild compatibility mode is required to get the exit code and determine the success of a process when PHP has been compiled with the --enable-sigchild option

description.compact: Performs a check between the timeout definition and the time the process started.

docblock.description: In case you run a background process (with the start method), you should trigger this method regularly to ensure the process timeout

throws.description: In case the timeout was reached

description.compact: Returns whether PTY is supported on the current operating system.
Creates the descriptors needed by the proc_open.
Builds up the callback used by wait().

docblock.description: The callbacks adds all occurred output to the specific buffer and calls the user callback (if present) with the received output.

description.compact: Updates the status of the process, reads pipes.

param.description: Whether to use a blocking read call

description.compact: Returns whether PHP has been compiled with the '--enable-sigchild' option or not.
Reads pipes for the freshest output.

param.description: name of the method that needs fresh outputs

throws.description: in case output has been disabled or process is not started

description.compact: Validates and returns the filtered timeout.

throws.description: if the given timeout is a negative number

description.compact: Reads pipes, executes callback.

param.description: Whether to use blocking calls or not
Whether to close file handles or not

description.compact: Closes process resource, closes file handles, sets the exitcode.

comment.value: Free memory from self-reference callback created by buildCallback
Doing so in other contexts like __destruct or by garbage collector is ineffective
Now pipes are closed, so the callback is no longer necessary

description.compact: Resets data related to the latest run of the process.
Sends a POSIX signal to the process.

param.description: Whether to throw exception in case signal failed

return.description: True if the signal was sent successfully, false otherwise

throws.description: In case the process is not running
In case --enable-sigchild is activated and the process can't be killed
In case of failure

description.compact: Ensures the process is running or terminated, throws a LogicException if the process has a not started.

param.description: The function name that was called

throws.description: If the process has not run.

description.compact: Ensures the process is terminated, throws a LogicException if the process has a status different than `terminated`.

param.description: The function name that was called

throws.description: If the process is not yet terminated.
